body_html:
@peterjc123
Few things.

  1. Until now I installed using conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch , I didnt know about your other build repository, this is why I thouth that the build failed since the last build in from August. All the problems I reported where using this version with conda 3.5.

  2. I downloaded your new WHL file, I installed latest conda from scratch, I have MKL from pip and also MKL from intel's web site.

  3. I also have cuda 8 and cuDNN 6

  4. With this configuration, I am still getting the same DLL error.

  5. I am sure CUDA works since with PyCUDA I have no issues.

  6. I also have VC 15 and VC 17 installed.

What am I doing wrong?

I downloaded your new WHL file, I installed latest conda  from scratch, I have MKL from pip and also MKL from intel's web site.


I also have cuda 8 and cuDNN 6


With this configuration, I am still getting the same DLL error.


I am sure CUDA works since with PyCUDA I have no issues.

What am I doing wrong?
body:
@peterjc123 
Few things. 

1. Until now I installed using ```conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch``` , I didnt know about your other build repository, this is why I thouth that the build failed since the last build in from August. All the problems I reported where using this version with conda 3.5. 

2. I downloaded your new WHL file, I installed latest conda  from scratch, I have MKL from pip and also MKL from intel's web site.

3. I also have cuda 8 and cuDNN 6 

4. With this configuration, I am still getting the same DLL error. 

5. I am sure CUDA works since with PyCUDA I have no issues. 

6. I also have VC 15 and VC 17 installed. 

What am I doing wrong?
